stateWideResources.name: 2-1-1 Arizona
stateWideResources.description: 2-1-1 Arizona is a comprehensive information and referral service that connects individuals and families to over 8,500 local and statewide resources. The service helps people find assistance with basic needs, housing, utilities, food, healthcare, employment, and other essential services.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: Dial 2-1-1 within Arizona | 877-211-8661 from anywhere | Fax: 602-263-0979 | Arizona Relay: 7-1-1 or 800-367-8939 | Address: 1275 W. Washington St. Suite 210, Tempe, AZ 85288
stateWideResources.notes: Available by phone from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. Monday through Friday. Website search available 24/7. Cannot help people in person at their office.

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence (ACESDV)
stateWideResources.description: A statewide coalition that provides support, resources, and advocacy for victims of sexual and domestic violence across Arizona. They operate a 24/7 helpline and connect survivors with local services.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 602-279-2980 or 1-800-782-6400 (Arizona Sexual and Domestic Violence Helpline) | Email: Contact through website form | Address: Phoenix, Arizona (serves statewide)
stateWideResources.phone: 602-279-2980 or 1-800-782-6400 (Arizona Sexual and Domestic Violence Helpline)
stateWideResources.eligibility: Victims of sexual and domestic violence in Arizona
stateWideResources.hours: 24/7 helpline; Office hours by appointment only
services: Connection to local domestic violence programs

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence (ACESDV)
stateWideResources.description: A statewide coalition providing support, resources, and advocacy for victims of sexual and domestic violence across Arizona. They operate the Arizona Sexual and Domestic Violence Helpline, offering multiple ways to connect with support services.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 602-279-2900 (Office), 800-782-6400 (Helpline) | Email: info@acesdv.org | Address: 2800 N. Central Ave., Suite 1570, Phoenix, AZ 85004
stateWideResources.address: 2800 N. Central Ave., Suite 1570, Phoenix, AZ 85004
stateWideResources.eligibility: Anyone affected by sexual or domestic violence in Arizona
stateWideResources.hours: Helpline: Mon 8:30-5, Tues 8:30-7, Wed-Fri 8:30-5; Office hours may vary
services: Referrals to local programs and shelters

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Coalition to End Sexual and Domestic Violence (ACESDV)
stateWideResources.description: Statewide coalition providing support and resources for sexual and domestic violence survivors through helpline services, local program connections, and resources.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Survivors of sexual and domestic violence

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security
stateWideResources.description: State agency providing various assistance programs
stateWideResources.notes: Distance to service centers creates access barriers

stateWideResources.name: 211 Arizona
stateWideResources.notes: Phone-based service helps overcome geographic barriers

stateWideResources.name: Wildfire Arizona
stateWideResources.notes: Limited direct services in remote areas

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security Homeless Services
stateWideResources.description: A state agency that coordinates homeless services through federal and state funds, contracting with nonprofit and local government entities to provide rapid rehousing, emergency shelter, homeless prevention, and street outreach services throughout Arizona.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing a housing crisis in Arizona

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Health Care Cost Containment System (AHCCCS)
stateWideResources.description: Arizona's Medicaid agency that offers health care programs to serve Arizona residents. They provide resources for locating substance abuse treatment and opioid services throughout the state, including in Pinal County.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 602-417-4000 (General), 602-586-1841 or 1-800-624-3879 (Mercy Care Member Services for Pinal County) | Email: Contact through website | Address: 801 E. Jefferson, Phoenix, AZ 85034
stateWideResources.phone: 602-417-4000 (General), 602-586-1841 or 1-800-624-3879 (Mercy Care Member Services for Pinal County)
stateWideResources.eligibility: Arizona residents; some services available regardless of insurance status
stateWideResources.hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM; Crisis services available 24/7

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security (DES) Homeless Services
stateWideResources.description: The DES Homeless Coordination Office contracts with nonprofit and local government entities to provide rapid rehousing, emergency shelter, homeless prevention, and street outreach services throughout Arizona, including Jerome.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Veterans' Services (ADVS)
stateWideResources.description: State-funded agency committed to serving Arizona veterans, service members, and their families by ensuring they receive high-quality services.
stateWideResources.eligibility: Arizona veterans, service members, and their families

stateWideResources.name: Teen Lifeline
stateWideResources.description: Crisis line for teenagers where callers can talk to trained peer counselors about any problem or issue.
stateWideResources.hours: 3pm-9pm: Peer counselors; Other hours: Adult counselors

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security - Homeless Services
stateWideResources.description: The DES Homeless Coordination Office contracts with not for profit and local government entities to provide homeless services throughout Arizona, including Cordes Lakes. Services include Rapid Rehousing, Emergency Shelter, Homeless Prevention, and Street Outreach.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 211 | Address: Statewide service covering Cordes Lakes, AZ
stateWideResources.address: Statewide service covering Cordes Lakes, AZ
stateWideResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness or at risk of becoming homeless
stateWideResources.hours: Varies by program, call 211 for information

stateWideResources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security
stateWideResources.description: The Arizona Department of Economic Security provides various support services for people with disabilities, seniors, and low-income families in Dewey-Humboldt. Their AZ Links program serves as Arizona's Aging and Disability Resource Center.
stateWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 844-770-9500 | Address: 1789 W. Jefferson, Phoenix, AZ 85007
stateWideResources.eligibility: Arizona residents with disabilities, seniors, and low-income families

countyWideResources.name: Pima County Coordinating Agencies for Housing and Services
countyWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of agencies and organizations providing housing assistance, shelter, and support services for individuals experiencing homelessness in Pima County, including resources accessible to Ajo residents.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Multiple agencies with varying contact information - See website for complete listing
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness in Pima County
countyWideResources.notes: Resources include Arizona 211, Old Pueblo Community Services, Our Family Services, Center of Opportunity, Salvation Army, Pio Decimo Center, CODAC, La Frontera Arizona RAPP, Primavera Foundation, and Tucson Pima Collaboration to End Homelessness. While most services are based in Tucson, they serve the entire county including Ajo.

countyWideResources.name: Pima County Homeless Services Division
countyWideResources.description: A county-wide service division that provides support for individuals and families experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness, including outreach, prevention, emergency shelter, and housing assistance.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-724-7300 (Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.) | Sullivan Jackson Employment Center
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness in Pima County
countyWideResources.notes: While there are no homeless services located specifically within Anegam city limits, residents can access county-wide services through the Pima County Homeless Services Division, which operates out of the Sullivan Jackson Employment Center and has served homeless households since 1989.

countyWideResources.name: Pima County Office of Housing Opportunities and Homeless Solutions
countyWideResources.description: A county-wide service division that provides centralized information and coordination of services for individuals and families experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness in Pima County, including Marana residents.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-724-7300 | Email: HousingOpportunities@pima.gov | Address: 115 N Church Ave, Tucson, AZ
countyWideResources.address: 115 N Church Ave, Tucson, AZ
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness in Pima County, including Marana residents
countyWideResources.hours: Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.

countyWideResources.name: Pima Council on Aging
countyWideResources.description: Pima Council on Aging (PCOA) is a nonprofit organization that provides resources, services, and advocacy for older adults in Pima County, helping them age with dignity and independence.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: (520) 790-7262 | Address: 600 S. Country Club Road, Tucson, AZ 85716
countyWideResources.address: 600 S. Country Club Road, Tucson, AZ 85716
countyWideResources.eligibility: Older adults in Pima County, primarily those 60+

countyWideResources.name: Child & Family Resources
countyWideResources.description: Nonprofit organization providing support services for children and families in Pima County
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-783-2943 | Email: Not specified on website | Address: 2800 East Broadway Blvd., Tucson, AZ 85716
countyWideResources.address: 2800 East Broadway Blvd., Tucson, AZ 85716
countyWideResources.eligibility: Families with children in Pima County

countyWideResources.name: Primavera Foundation
countyWideResources.description: Primavera Foundation co-creates tangible pathways out of poverty with individuals and families. They focus on the root causes of poverty and homelessness and partner with community members to overcome barriers to safe, affordable, permanent housing.

countyWideResources.name: Tucson Pima Collaboration to End Homelessness
countyWideResources.description: TPCH is a coalition of community and faith-based organizations, government entities, businesses, and individuals committed to ending homelessness in Tucson and Pima County. They coordinate services, provide resources, and work to develop solutions to homelessness throughout the region.
services: Coordinates homeless services across Pima County
Provides resources and referrals for homeless individuals
Operates coordinated entry system for housing assistance

countyWideResources.name: Youth On Their Own
countyWideResources.description: Youth On Their Own (YOTO) supports the high school graduation and continued success of youth experiencing homelessness in Pima County. They strive to eliminate barriers to education and empower housing insecure youth to stay in school by providing financial assistance, basic human needs, guidance, and more.

countyWideResources.name: Bread & Roses Crisis Transitional Shelter For Homeless LGBTQ+ Youth
countyWideResources.description: A transitional shelter program providing housing and support services for homeless young adults who identify as LGBTQ+, including case management and services that lead to self-sufficiency.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Emerson Kuhn | Phone: (520) 547-6109 | Email: ekuhn@saaf.org | Address: 375 S. Euclid Ave., Tucson, AZ 85719-6644
countyWideResources.eligibility: Youth age 18-24 who identify as lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, or questioning
countyWideResources.notes: Program is operated by the Southern Arizona AIDS Foundation (SAAF) and serves LGBTQ+ youth throughout Pima County, including residents of Ak Chin.

countyWideResources.name: Tucson Pima Collaboration to End Homelessness (TPCH)
countyWideResources.description: A county-wide resource directory and coordination system for homeless services in Pima County, providing access to emergency shelter, housing assessments, and support services for individuals experiencing homelessness.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Website: https://tpch.net/ | Resource Directory: https://pima.myresourcedirectory.com/
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness in Pima County
countyWideResources.notes: While there are no homeless shelters located within Ali Chuk city limits, residents can access services through the Tucson Pima Collaboration to End Homelessness (TPCH), which coordinates homeless services throughout Pima County. The resource directory provides information on shelter beds, housing programs, and support services.
countyWideResources.languageSupport: English, Spanish, and translation services available

countyWideResources.name: Emerge Center Against Domestic Abuse
countyWideResources.description: The largest provider of comprehensive domestic abuse services and programs in Southern Arizona, offering court advocacy, crisis intervention, safety planning, and support services for victims of domestic violence.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Hotline (24/7): 520-795-4266 or 1-888-428-0101 | Community-based services: 520-881-7201 (Mon-Fri 8:30AM-5:00PM) | City Court Advocate: 520-837-3012 (Mon-Fri 8:00AM-4:30PM)
countyWideResources.eligibility: All individuals experiencing domestic abuse regardless of age, income, ethnicity, gender, sex, sexual orientation, sexual expression, ability, religion, national origin, or immigration status
countyWideResources.notes: Emerge delivers confidential, trauma-informed services via court advocates who help survivors navigate the criminal justice system, offer information about rights and options, provide emotional support, accompany survivors to court proceedings, and assist with orders of protection and safety planning. Services are available to residents throughout Pima County, including Ali Chukson.

countyWideResources.name: Sullivan Jackson Employment Center (Pima County)
countyWideResources.description: A county-wide employment center that helps individuals experiencing homelessness find employment and housing opportunities through job training, resume assistance, and employment placement services.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Website: https://www.tucsonaz.gov/Departments/Housing-and-Community-Development/Homelessness/Resources-for-People-Experiencing-Homelessness
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness in Pima County
countyWideResources.notes: While there are no homeless services located specifically within Ali Molina city limits, residents can access county-wide services through the Sullivan Jackson Employment Center, which provides employment assistance and housing support for individuals experiencing homelessness throughout Pima County.

countyWideResources.name: Pima County LGBTQIA+ Community Resources
countyWideResources.description: A comprehensive directory of organizations, support services, and resources for LGBTQIA+ individuals in Pima County, including services accessible to Casas Adobes residents.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Multiple organizations with varying contact information - See website for complete listing
countyWideResources.eligibility: LGBTQIA+ individuals and allies in Pima County
countyWideResources.notes: Resources include Anti-Violence Project (AVP), Southern Arizona AIDS Foundation, Arizona Queer Archives, EON Youth Lounge, Equality Arizona, Family Pride Initiative, and many other organizations providing support, healthcare, crisis services, and community connections for LGBTQIA+ individuals throughout Pima County including Casas Adobes.

countyWideResources.name: Pima County Homeless Services for Catalina
countyWideResources.description: While there are no homeless shelters located within Catalina city limits, residents can access homeless services and shelters in nearby Tucson and throughout Pima County.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: For assistance, contact Arizona 211 or visit the Pima County Coordinating Agencies for Housing and Services website
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness in Catalina and Pima County
countyWideResources.notes: Nearby resources include Primavera Men's Shelter, The Salvation Army Hospitality House, and The Primavera Foundation Shelter for families, all located in Tucson. Catalina residents must travel to access these services as there are no local shelters within city limits.

countyWideResources.name: DomesticShelters.org Resource Directory
countyWideResources.description: A comprehensive online directory that helps domestic violence victims find local shelters, programs, and support services throughout Pima County and nationwide. The service provides searchable listings of shelters and programs based on location.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Website: https://www.domesticshelters.org/ | National Domestic Violence Hotline: 1-800-799-7233
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing domestic violence or abuse
countyWideResources.notes: While there are no domestic violence services located specifically within Chiawuli Tak city limits, residents can access county-wide and national services through DomesticShelters.org, which provides a searchable database of shelters and programs. The Arizona DES domestic violence resources were inaccessible at the time of processing due to website access issues.
countyWideResources.languageSupport: English, Spanish, and multiple other languages through hotline services

countyWideResources.name: Arizona DES Homeless Services for Drexel Heights
countyWideResources.description: State-level homeless services and resources available to Drexel Heights residents through the Arizona Department of Economic Security, including rapid rehousing, emergency shelter, homeless prevention, and street outreach programs.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Call 211 for assistance or visit the Arizona DES website
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness or at risk of homelessness in Drexel Heights and Pima County
countyWideResources.notes: While there are no homeless shelters located within Drexel Heights city limits, residents can access services through the DES Homeless Coordination Office and Pima County resources. The DES collaborates with Continuums of Care (CoC) to ensure needs are assessed and addressed throughout Arizona.
countyWideResources.languageSupport: English, Spanish, and multiple other languages through translation services

countyWideResources.name: The Lighthouse Project
countyWideResources.description: Provides LGBTQ+ affirming and trauma-informed supportive services for individuals experiencing housing instability. The program offers links to permanent supportive housing, case management, and other support services.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: 1037 E. 34th St., Tucson, AZ 85713 | Phone: (520) 909-0754 | Case management: Monday-Friday | Intake: Wednesday
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals who identify as LGBTQ+ experiencing housing instability
countyWideResources.notes: While there are no homeless services located specifically within Gu Oidak city limits, residents can access this county-wide service that provides specialized support for LGBTQ+ individuals experiencing housing instability.
countyWideResources.languageSupport: English, Spanish services may be available

countyWideResources.name: The Primavera Foundation
countyWideResources.description: Provides comprehensive emergency shelter and support services for individuals experiencing homelessness, including men's shelter, women's shelter (Casa Paloma), family shelter (Family Pathways), veteran services, transitional housing, and drop-in services at their Resource Center.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Resource Center: 702 S. 6th Ave, Tucson, AZ 85701 | Phone: 520-623-5111
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness in Pima County; specific programs have specific eligibility requirements
countyWideResources.notes: While there are no homeless services located specifically within Littletown city limits, residents can access this county-wide service. The Resource Center is open Mondays, Wednesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays from 9 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. (closed Tuesdays, weekends, and holidays).

countyWideResources.name: City of Tucson Housing First Program
countyWideResources.description: A comprehensive program that provides street outreach, emergency shelter, housing navigation, and supportive housing services for individuals and families experiencing homelessness in Pima County, including Nolic residents.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-791-4171 | Email: HCDAdmin@tucsonaz.gov | Address: 310 N Commerce Park Loop, Tucson, AZ 85745
countyWideResources.address: 310 N Commerce Park Loop, Tucson, AZ 85745
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness in Pima County, including Nolic residents

countyWideResources.name: Kino Veterans' Workforce Center
countyWideResources.description: A comprehensive support center for veterans that provides employment assistance, training, benefits counseling, and other essential services to help veterans and their families in Pima County, including Rillito residents.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-724-2646 | Address: 2801 E. Ajo Way, Tucson, AZ 85714
countyWideResources.address: 2801 E. Ajo Way, Tucson, AZ 85714
countyWideResources.eligibility: Veterans and their families in Pima County, including Rillito residents

countyWideResources.name: Family Resource Center at Sahuarita Food Bank
countyWideResources.description: A community resource center that provides family support programs, educational activities, and food assistance for families in Sahuarita. Offers programs like Preschool Play for ages 3-5, Fun Family Fitness, and Nature Play activities.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-771-2372 | Email: irodela@sfb-crc.org | Address: 17750 S. La Canada, Sahuarita, AZ
countyWideResources.address: 17750 S. La Canada, Sahuarita, AZ
countyWideResources.eligibility: Families with children in the Sahuarita area

countyWideResources.name: Valley Assistance Services
countyWideResources.description: A nonprofit organization providing assistance for housing, utilities, financial education, and workforce training for families and seniors in the Sahuarita and Green Valley region, in addition to other health and safety programs.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-625-5966 | Address: 3950 S. Camino del Heroe, Green Valley, AZ 85614
countyWideResources.address: 3950 S. Camino del Heroe, Green Valley, AZ 85614
countyWideResources.eligibility: Families and seniors in the Sahuarita and Green Valley region

countyWideResources.name: Pima County Youth Health Hub
countyWideResources.description: A resource navigation tool designed to assist youth and young adults (ages 24 and under) and their parents/caregivers in finding community resources tailored to their needs. The program connects youth with health, wellness, and safety resources throughout Pima County.
countyWideResources.eligibility: Youth and young adults ages 24 and under, and their parents/caregivers. Anyone under 13 must have parent's permission.

countyWideResources.name: Pima Council on Aging (PCOA) Transportation Services
countyWideResources.description: Provides resources on transportation programs and volunteer services for the elderly in South Tucson and surrounding areas. Various organizations offer door-to-door rides by volunteers in the community.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-790-7262 (Pima County on aging helpline), 520-406-6959 | Address: 8467 E. Broadway Blvd., Tucson, AZ 85710
countyWideResources.address: 8467 E. Broadway Blvd., Tucson, AZ 85710
countyWideResources.eligibility: Elderly residents in South Tucson and surrounding areas

countyWideResources.name: HSL Center of Opportunity
countyWideResources.description: The HSL Center of Opportunity is a collaborative homeless shelter campus in Tucson that brings together over 30 nonprofit organizations to provide comprehensive services for people experiencing homelessness. The center offers a range of services including shelter, healthcare, workforce development, and support for the journey out of homelessness.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Address: 4550 S Palo Verde Rd, Tucson, AZ 85714
countyWideResources.address: 4550 S Palo Verde Rd, Tucson, AZ 85714
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness in Tucson and Pima County

countyWideResources.name: Community Food Bank of Southern Arizona
countyWideResources.description: The Community Food Bank of Southern Arizona provides food assistance, prepared meals, and emergency groceries to individuals and families in need throughout Tucson and Pima County. They offer an interactive map to find food resources by zip code or cross streets.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Address: 2411 E Ft Lowell Rd, Tucson, AZ 85719
countyWideResources.address: 2411 E Ft Lowell Rd, Tucson, AZ 85719
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families in need of food assistance in Tucson and Pima County
countyWideResources.hours: Tuesday: 1:00 PM - 4:00 PM, Wednesday: 1:00 PM - 4:00 PM, Thursday: 1:00 AM - 4:00 PM

countyWideResources.name: Department of Economic Security - Tucson
countyWideResources.description: The Arizona Department of Economic Security (DES) is a partner organization at the Center of Opportunity in Tucson, providing government benefits, veterans assistance, and support services for individuals experiencing homelessness. They are part of the collaborative campus approach to addressing homelessness holistically.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Address: 4550 S. Palo Verde Rd., Tucson, AZ 85714
countyWideResources.address: 4550 S. Palo Verde Rd., Tucson, AZ 85714
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness and other vulnerable populations in Tucson and Pima County

countyWideResources.name: El Rio Community Health Center
countyWideResources.description: El Rio Community Health Center is a partner organization at the Center of Opportunity in Tucson, providing comprehensive healthcare services to individuals experiencing homelessness and other vulnerable populations. They offer medical, dental, and mental health care as part of the collaborative campus approach to addressing homelessness.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Address: 4550 S. Palo Verde Rd., Tucson, AZ 85714
countyWideResources.address: 4550 S. Palo Verde Rd., Tucson, AZ 85714
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness and other vulnerable populations in Tucson and Pima County

countyWideResources.name: Gospel Rescue Mission
countyWideResources.description: Gospel Rescue Mission provides comprehensive services for individuals experiencing homelessness in Tucson, including emergency shelter, recovery programs, employment assistance, housing support, and outreach services. They are located at the Center of Opportunity, a collaborative campus with over 30 partner organizations.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: (520) 740-1501 | Address: 4550 S. Palo Verde Rd., Tucson, AZ 85714
countyWideResources.address: 4550 S. Palo Verde Rd., Tucson, AZ 85714
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness in Tucson and Pima County

countyWideResources.name: La Frontera Arizona
countyWideResources.description: La Frontera Arizona is a partner organization at the Center of Opportunity in Tucson, providing behavioral health services, substance abuse treatment, and mental health support for individuals experiencing homelessness and other vulnerable populations. They are part of the collaborative campus approach to addressing homelessness holistically.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Address: 4550 S. Palo Verde Rd., Tucson, AZ 85714
countyWideResources.address: 4550 S. Palo Verde Rd., Tucson, AZ 85714
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness and other vulnerable populations in Tucson and Pima County

countyWideResources.name: Tucson Pima Collaboration to End Homelessness (TPCH) Coordinated Entry
countyWideResources.description: Coordinated Entry is the first step for people experiencing homelessness to obtain housing in Tucson and Pima County. TPCH provides shelter referrals, hot meal locations, eviction prevention assistance, and coordinates homeless services through their Coordinated Entry System.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Email: tpch@tucsonaz.gov
countyWideResources.eligibility: Individuals and families experiencing or at risk of homelessness in Tucson and Pima County

countyWideResources.name: National Community Health Partners
countyWideResources.description: National Community Health Partners is a nonprofit organization that provides mental health support, peer-led groups, and suicide prevention services for veterans and their families in Pima County.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: (520) 795-9756 | Address: Tucson, AZ
countyWideResources.address: Tucson, AZ
countyWideResources.eligibility: Veterans and their families in Pima County
services: Best Is Yet to Come program

countyWideResources.name: Youth on the Rise
countyWideResources.description: Youth on the Rise (YOTR) is a resource platform developed to help youth and young adults navigate services, resources, and information in Pima County, providing guidance on education, employment, housing, health services, and more.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Address: Pima County, AZ
countyWideResources.address: Pima County, AZ
countyWideResources.eligibility: Youth and young adults in Pima County

countyWideResources.name: Pima Council on Aging (PCOA)
countyWideResources.description: Pima County's leading experts on aging well, advocacy, and unbiased information for older people and their families. Founded in 1967, PCOA was among the first aging services organizations in the nation.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: (520) 790-7262 | Email: help@pcoa.org | Address: 600 S Country Club, Tucson, AZ 85716
countyWideResources.address: 600 S Country Club, Tucson, AZ 85716
countyWideResources.eligibility: Older adults in Pima County, including Kleindale area

countyWideResources.name: Primavera Foundation
countyWideResources.description: The Primavera Foundation provides emergency shelter and services to individuals experiencing homelessness in Pima County, with a mission to provide pathways out of poverty.

countyWideResources.name: Youth On Their Own (YOTO)
countyWideResources.description: Youth On Their Own supports the high school graduation and continued success of youth experiencing homelessness in Pima County, striving to eliminate barriers to education and empower housing insecure youth to stay in school.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-293-1136 | Email: Not specified on website | Address: 2525 N Country Club Rd, Tucson, AZ 85716

countyWideResources.name: Youth on the Rise (YOTR)

countyWideResources.name: Picture Rocks Community Center
countyWideResources.description: A community center that provides youth and teen programs with discounted rates for low-income families, including after-school programs, summer recreation, and teen leadership opportunities.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-682-7166 | Address: Picture Rocks, AZ
countyWideResources.address: Picture Rocks, AZ
countyWideResources.eligibility: Children ages 5-12 for after-school program; K-5th grade for summer recreation; 6th-9th grade for teen leadership; Low-income families eligible for discounted rates with proof of qualification (SNAP, Free/reduced school lunch, TANF, AHCCCS, Section 8)
countyWideResources.hours: Varies by program; After-School Program: School dismissal until 6 p.m.; Summer Programs: Monday-Thursday, 7:30 a.m.-5:00 p.m.

countyWideResources.name: Rillito Center
countyWideResources.description: A specialized education facility for students with high needs from preschool to age 22, providing special education services, assistive technology, and individualized learning experiences to help students reach their highest potential and develop independence.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Address: Rillito, AZ
countyWideResources.address: Rillito, AZ
countyWideResources.eligibility: Students with special education needs from preschool to age 22

countyWideResources.name: Disabled American Veterans (DAV) Chapter 38
countyWideResources.description: A veterans service organization that helps veterans navigate the VA disability claims process, securing benefits for approximately 600 area veterans. They provide free assistance with disability claims and connect veterans with healthcare resources.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Email: arizonadav38@gmail.com | Address: Sahuarita Food Bank and Resource Center, Sahuarita, AZ
countyWideResources.address: Sahuarita Food Bank and Resource Center, Sahuarita, AZ
countyWideResources.eligibility: Veterans in the Sahuarita and Green Valley area

countyWideResources.name: Pima County Public Library - Teen 365 Program
countyWideResources.description: A library-based program that helps teens explore, create, collaborate, and succeed through makerspaces, online tools, in-person classes, and various resources.
countyWideResources.contactInfo: Phone: Not specified on website for specific program | Email: Not specified on website | Address: Multiple library locations throughout Pima County
countyWideResources.phone: Not specified on website for specific program
countyWideResources.address: Multiple library locations throughout Pima County
countyWideResources.eligibility: Teens and tweens (ages 9-18)
services: Youth Health Action Team focused on mental health

localResources.name: Catalina Foothills School District McKinney-Vento Program
localResources.description: A comprehensive support program for homeless children and youth in the Catalina Foothills School District, providing educational stability and resources for students experiencing homelessness.
localResources.contactInfo: Dr. Erin Matyjasik | Phone: 520-209-8081 | Special Services Department
localResources.eligibility: School-age children and youth who lack a fixed, regular, and adequate nighttime residence due to loss of housing, economic hardship, or similar reason
localResources.notes: Services include school enrollment assistance, transportation to school of origin, automatic enrollment in free lunch program, and connection to additional support services. The program follows the federal McKinney-Vento Homeless Education Act to ensure educational stability for homeless students.

localResources.name: Poverello House of Tucson
localResources.description: Poverello House of Tucson is a nonprofit organization providing a homelike place of welcome and a safe environment with daytime rest, food, laundry facilities, showers, and companionship for men and women experiencing homelessness.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: (520) 637-8916 | Address: Tucson, AZ (specific address not publicly listed for security)
localResources.eligibility: Adults experiencing homelessness
localResources.serviceArea: Tucson metropolitan area (including Corona de Tucson)
localResources.notes: While there are no homeless services located specifically within Corona de Tucson city limits, residents can access services in nearby Tucson. Poverello House requires advance reservation due to limited capacity (10 guests per day).
localResources.hours: By reservation only, limited to 10 guests per day

localResources.name: Rescued Helpers
localResources.description: A non-profit organization serving as a lifeline for those in need, offering a range of services and resources to uplift and empower individuals facing various challenges, including those experiencing homelessness.
localResources.contactInfo: 1325 W Kleindale Rd, Tucson, AZ 85705 | Phone: +1 (520) 888-7377
localResources.website: http://rescuedhelpers.com (Note: Website was inaccessible at time of verification)
localResources.eligibility: Individuals in need in the Tucson area
localResources.notes: This organization is physically located in Kleindale. Limited information is available as the website was inaccessible at time of verification. MapQuest description indicates they provide shelter and educational programs for those in need.

localResources.name: Greater Littletown Human Resources Group
localResources.description: A local community organization providing resources and support services to individuals experiencing homelessness and other vulnerable populations in the Littletown area.
localResources.eligibility: Residents of Littletown and surrounding areas in need of assistance
localResources.notes: This organization is specifically mentioned in the Tucson Arizona Homeless Shelters & Services resource list as serving the Littletown area. Limited information is available about specific programs offered.

localResources.name: Tohono O'odham Nation Child Care Services
localResources.description: An early care and education service provider serving low-income families in the Tohono O'odham Nation, including Pisinemo, with child care centers and various provider options for children from 6 months through age 12.
localResources.contactInfo: Address: Pisinemo, AZ (Tohono O'odham Nation)
localResources.eligibility: Low-income families with children from 6 months through age 12 in the Tohono O'odham Nation

localResources.name: Clinica Amistad
localResources.description: A free clinic offering medical services to those who are unemployed or uninsured in South Tucson and surrounding areas. Staffed by volunteers and providers who speak Spanish, making healthcare accessible to the Spanish-speaking community.
localResources.eligibility: Unemployed or uninsured individuals in South Tucson and surrounding areas

localResources.name: Tucson Clinica Medica Familiar
localResources.description: A medical clinic providing healthcare services to families in South Tucson, with a focus on serving the Spanish-speaking community and providing culturally competent care.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-620-1200 | Address: 3770 S. 16th Ave., Tucson, AZ 85713
localResources.eligibility: All residents, with focus on Spanish-speaking families

localResources.name: El Rio Health Center (El Pueblo, Summit)
localResources.description: A community health center providing comprehensive healthcare services to residents of South Tucson and surrounding areas, with a focus on accessible and affordable care for underserved populations.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-670-3909 | Address: 101 W. Irvington Rd., building 10, Tucson, AZ 85714
localResources.address: 101 W. Irvington Rd., building 10, Tucson, AZ 85714
localResources.eligibility: All residents, with sliding fee scale for uninsured and low-income patients

localResources.name: VA Medical Center - Southern Arizona Health Care
localResources.description: A comprehensive medical center providing healthcare services to veterans in South Tucson and surrounding areas, offering primary care, specialty services, mental health care, and other veteran-specific health programs.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-792-1450 | Address: 3601 S. 6th Ave., Tucson, AZ 85723
localResources.eligibility: Veterans enrolled in VA healthcare system

localResources.name: Green Spirits Healing Veterans Retreat
localResources.description: A healing retreat program for veterans in Three Points that helps them overcome mental health issues like PTSD and depression. The program includes building raised garden beds, plant therapy, animal connection therapy, yoga, massage therapy, and group discussions with mental health professionals.
localResources.contactInfo: Address: VFW 10254, Three Points, AZ
localResources.eligibility: Veterans experiencing mental health issues

localResources.name: Three Points Veterans Memorial Park
localResources.description: A community park honoring veterans that features baseball fields, a basketball court, playground with shade structure, picnic tables, and ramadas available for reservation. The park serves as both a recreational facility and a memorial to veterans in the Three Points area.
localResources.contactInfo: Address: 10211 S Sasabe Hwy, Tucson, AZ 85736
localResources.eligibility: Open to the public

localResources.name: VFW Post 10254
localResources.description: A Veterans of Foreign Wars post serving veterans and the community in Three Points. The post organizes events like Day of Service, supports veteran-owned businesses, provides health services, and runs programs like the Warriors Garden Program in partnership with Green Spirits Healing.
localResources.eligibility: Veterans of foreign wars and their families

localResources.name: Caridad Community Kitchen
localResources.description: Caridad Community Kitchen provides hot meals to individuals experiencing food insecurity in Tucson. They serve meals Monday through Friday from 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: (520) 882-5641 | Address: 845 N Main Ave, Tucson, AZ 85719
localResources.eligibility: Open to the public, no ID required

localResources.name: His Presence Church Arizona
localResources.description: His Presence Church Arizona provides hot meals to individuals experiencing food insecurity in Tucson. They serve meals on the 2nd and 4th Fridays of each month.
localResources.contactInfo: Address: 4108 E North St, Tucson, AZ
localResources.eligibility: Open to the public, no ID required

localResources.name: Holy Family Church
localResources.description: Holy Family Church provides hot meals to individuals experiencing food insecurity in Tucson. They serve meals on Sunday afternoons.
localResources.contactInfo: Address: 338 W University Blvd, Tucson, AZ
localResources.eligibility: Open to the public, no ID required

localResources.name: Northminster Presbyterian Church
localResources.description: Northminster Presbyterian Church provides hot meals to individuals experiencing food insecurity in Tucson. They serve dinner on Monday evenings.
localResources.contactInfo: Address: 2450 E Ft Lowell, Tucson, AZ
localResources.eligibility: Open to the public, no ID required

localResources.name: Z-Mansion
localResources.description: Z-Mansion provides grab & go meals for individuals experiencing food insecurity in Tucson. They serve breakfast on Sunday mornings.
localResources.contactInfo: Address: 288 N Church Ave, Tucson, AZ
localResources.eligibility: Open to the public, no ID required

localResources.name: Greater Vail Community ReSources
localResources.description: Greater Vail Community ReSources is a 501(c)(3) Arizona nonprofit organization that provides emergency food assistance to families in need, meals for the home-bound, and supplemental weekend food bags for students in the Vail, Corona de Tucson, and Southeast Tucson areas.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520.338.2610 | Address: 13105 E Colossal Cave Road, Vail 85641
localResources.eligibility: Residents in need in the Vail, Corona de Tucson, Rita Ranch, and Southeast Tucson areas
services: Weekend "Meals to Grow" bags for students

localResources.name: Haven Totes
localResources.description: Haven Totes is a 100% volunteer-run nonprofit organization that provides food assistance to low-income families with children in Tucson area schools, serving over 1,000 families annually.
localResources.contactInfo: Address: Tucson, AZ
localResources.eligibility: Families of children in the schools served by Haven Totes
services: Weekend food bags for school children

localResources.name: Nexus Teen Academy
localResources.description: Nexus Teen Academy is a nonprofit organization providing residential treatment programs for teens struggling with mental health challenges, behavioral issues, and substance abuse in the Tucson area.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: (480) 485-3424 | Address: Tucson, AZ
localResources.eligibility: Teens struggling with mental health challenges, behavioral issues, and substance abuse

localResources.name: El Rio Health
localResources.description: A community health center providing comprehensive healthcare services to the Tucson area, including specialized care for LGBTQ+ individuals with transgender health services and HIV/AIDS treatment.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: (520) 670-3909 | Email: info@elrio.org | Address: Multiple locations throughout Tucson, AZ
localResources.eligibility: Open to all residents of Tucson and surrounding areas
services: Fresh produce distributions (in partnership with Community Food Bank)

localResources.name: Tohono O'odham Nation
localResources.description: The official tribal government of the Tohono O'odham Nation, providing services and programs to tribal members in Gu Oidak and other communities within the reservation.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: Not specified on website | Email: Not specified on website | Address: P.O. Box 837, Sells, AZ 85634
localResources.eligibility: Tohono O'odham tribal members

localResources.name: San Miguel Resource Center
localResources.description: A crisis center providing support for survivors of domestic violence and sexual assault. Services include 24-hour crisis intervention, emergency shelter, counseling, legal advocacy, and personal assistance for basic needs.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: 970-728-5660 or Toll-free 844-816-3915 | Email: advocacy@smrcco.org | Address: PO Box 3243, Telluride, CO 81435
localResources.eligibility: Survivors of domestic violence and sexual assault

localResources.name: Santa Rosa Homelessness Solutions
localResources.description: A city program that provides comprehensive services to address homelessness, including shelter, housing assistance, and support services. The program works through partnerships with County agencies and community organizations to implement both immediate and long-term strategies.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: 707-543-3311 | Email: homeless@srcity.org
localResources.eligibility: Individuals experiencing homelessness or at risk of becoming homeless in Santa Rosa area

localResources.name: Santa Rosa Junior College Student Resource Centers
localResources.description: A college-based resource center that provides support for students, staff, and faculty experiencing homelessness or housing insecurity. Services include shower access, hygiene supplies, emergency food, coordinated entry interviews, and referrals to housing resources.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: 707.522.2638 | Email: studentresourcecenter@santarosa.edu | Address: Santa Rosa Campus, Santa Rosa Junior College
localResources.address: Santa Rosa Campus, Santa Rosa Junior College
localResources.eligibility: Santa Rosa Junior College students, staff, and faculty experiencing homelessness or housing insecurity
localResources.hours: Virtual Walk-in Hours: Mondays & Thursdays: 9am-1pm, Tuesdays & Wednesdays: 12pm-4pm

localResources.name: Tohono O'odham Nation Komckud Ki: Domestic and Sexual Violence Prevention Program
localResources.description: A tribal program providing emergency shelter, 24/7 hotline, and comprehensive services for victims of domestic and sexual violence in the Tohono O'odham Nation. Services include emergency assistance, legal support, housing services, and community education.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: 866-666-4889 (24/7 Hotline), 520-383-6000 (Admin) | Address: Sells, AZ
localResources.eligibility: Victims of domestic and sexual violence in the Tohono O'odham Nation and surrounding areas

localResources.name: International Rescue Committee (IRC) - Phoenix/Tucson
localResources.description: A nonprofit organization providing comprehensive case management in the areas of social, legal, employment, psychiatric & medical services for immigrants and refugees. They help clients rebuild their lives and achieve financial stability through various programs.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: (602) 816-1793 | Email: Contact through website | Address: Multiple locations in Phoenix and Tucson
localResources.address: Multiple locations in Phoenix and Tucson
localResources.eligibility: Immigrants and refugees in Arizona

localResources.name: Pima Find a Ride
localResources.description: A directory of transportation services for the general public, people with disabilities, and older adults who need access to reliable transportation in the greater Tucson region, including South Tucson.
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: 520-792-1093 | Address: 1 E. Broadway Blvd., Suite 401, Tucson, AZ 85701
localResources.address: 1 E. Broadway Blvd., Suite 401, Tucson, AZ 85701
localResources.eligibility: General public, people with disabilities, and older adults in the greater Tucson region

localResources.name: Control Alt Delete
localResources.description: Nonprofit organization helping domestic violence victims flee abuse in Arizona
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: Not specified on accessible page | Email: Not specified on accessible page | Address: Not specified on accessible page

localResources.description: Nonprofit organization providing services for refugees, immigrants, and vulnerable populations
localResources.contactInfo: Phone: (602) 433-2440 | Email: Not specified on accessible page | Address: 4425 West Olive Avenue #400, Glendale, AZ 85302

localResources.description: An organization that celebrates, supports and unites LGBTQI+ older adults who are 55+ and their younger allies, providing community resources and support.

localResources.name: Family Housing Resources
localResources.description: Family Housing Resources (FHR) is a nonprofit service organization dedicated to building a community with equal access to quality affordable housing and pathways to increased wealth and financial freedom.
localResources.contactInfo: Address: Tucson, AZ
localResources.eligibility: Low to middle income families in the Tucson area
